abstract: A multibillion buyout of PHH, a vehicle fleet manager and residential mortgage lender, led by General Electric Credit and the Blackstone Group, appears to be on the brink of collapse because J.P. Morgan Chase and Lehman Brothers are threatening to scale back drastically part of the debt package for a portion of the two-stage takeover, PHH disclosed Monday.
lead_paragraph: A multibillion buyout of PHH, a vehicle fleet manager and residential mortgage lender, led by General Electric Credit and the Blackstone Group, appears to be on the brink of collapse because J.P. Morgan Chase and Lehman Brothers are threatening to scale back drastically part of the debt package for a portion of the two-stage takeover, PHH disclosed Monday.

abstract: With management firings, layoffs and strategy changes Randy Falco may have a plan, but it appears he is forging a new company from scratch.
snippet: With management firings, layoffs and strategy changes Randy Falco may have a plan, but it appears he is forging a new company from scratch.
lead_paragraph: When he first took over General Electric, Jack Welch fired so many people that he earned the nickname “Neutron Jack.” The devastation at AOL is so similar under the leadership of Randy Falco—a long time GE executive—that he may well earn the name “Neutron Randy.”
